meanings.definition: One who takes part in a parade.
meanings.sent1: The parader waved at the crowd during the parade.
meanings.sent2: The parader wore a colorful costume in the parade.
meanings.sent3: The parader tripped over their own feet and made everyone laugh during the parade.
meanings.sent4: The parader stood out like a shining star among the participants in the parade.
meanings.sent5: The parader's enthusiasm and energy brought joy to the parade.

meanings.definition: To walk or march in a parade.
meanings.sent1: Children love to parader along the streets during the parade.
meanings.sent2: The band will parader proudly in the upcoming parade.
meanings.sent3: The penguins decided to parader in a line, pretending to be in a parade.
meanings.sent4: The colorful floats will parader through the city, attracting everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The dancers will parader gracefully to the rhythm of the parade music.

meanings.definition: To display proudly or show off.
meanings.sent1: She would always parader her achievements to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The peacock loves to parader its beautiful feathers.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to parader around with its favorite toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The artist will parader their latest masterpiece at the art show.
meanings.sent5: The car enthusiast will parader their vintage collection at the car show.
